newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's Jan-Sep trade deficit down to $1.404 bln.
newsitem.headline: Peru's Jan-Sep trade deficit down to $1.404 bln.

text.p: Peru's trade deficit fell nine percent in the first nine months of the year to $1.404 billion from $1.540 billion in the same period last year, the Central Reserve Bank said Friday.
Exports grew 5.0 percent in the first nine months to $4.364 billion from $4.139 billion in the same period of 1995, the bank said in its weekly report.
Meanwhile, in the January to September period, imports rose 2.0 percent to $5.768 billion, compared with $5.679 billion in the same period last year.
Peru's commercial deficit more than doubled to $2.115 billion in 1995 from $1.021 billion the previous year.

Friday, the central bank report said traditional exports rose six percent to $3.190 billion in the first nine months, while non-traditional exports were also up six percent to $1.112 percent and "other" exports fell 34 percent to $62 million.

Among imports, consumer goods rose six percent to $1.339 billion, raw materials were flat at $2.408 billion, while capital goods imports fell two percent to $1.761 billion. The bank's category of "other" goods saw imports rise 21 percent to $260 million.
